> [[ HP: 14 / 35 ]]
> [[ Moonroot Poisoning: Dizzy ]]
> [[ Dazed ]]
> [[ Severe Bleeding ]]

Splash—as you land supine in the water below, the only light around you fading with an audible sizzling as steam rises off your white-hot blade. The world around you is blurry, and a bit discolored. Your body feels heavy, and it's getting harder to move. You struggle to your feet. A stony hand grips you at the ankle, and you almost panic before realizing it's a crystallized golem's corpse, fallen from above.

Then, you stumble.

> [[ HP: 13 / 35 ]]

An unfamiliar sensation—not painful, but somehow 'off'. Your wounds are bleeding.

> [[ HP: 11 / 35 ]]

You can see a faint light, some nebulous reflection from the ankle-deep water on the smooth labyrinth walls. You don't recall the layout of this place, preparing to fumble for your Unique Identifier to check Nel's map. In the distance ahead, a pair of glowing eyes tilts upward, fixated on you. You can't see anyone else. There's frantic footsteps and incoherent shouting echoing down the tunnel to your left, and the sound of a bird chirping from somewhere behind you.

What will you do?
> Other

38901275.name: Sylvetica
38901275.comment:
>>38900585

> [[ HP: 9 / 35 ]]

You're beginning to lose balance as you navigate your inventory. Quickly, you bandage your wounds and ignite a fluorescent torch, lighting your surroundings. You still feel a bit unsteady, but ready your sword and prepare to get on the move. The torchlight illuminates the cave walls, and the water beneath your feet—you wonder why you can't see into the Sanctum above, as where light should be shining down from there, you see only a wall of darkness. Did you fall through that? Or, how far did you fall?

> [[ HP: 14 / 35 ]]
> [[ Moonroot Poisoning: Dizzy ]]
> [[ Dazed ]]

Ahead, you see the boss from before, stomping through the labyrinthine tunnel, stone body sparking as it grinds against the walls. It looks to be quite damaged, missing most of its arm due to your attack, but still stomping towards you—you recall the laser attack, but too late, as your body seems to be moving sluggishly still. With a target in its sights, its head flicks upward from floor to ceiling, and you feel the searing beam slice into your shoulder.

> [[ HP: 7 / 35 ]]

You scramble backwards, coming to your senses, and fumble for a lesser healing potion, imbibing it and diving to one side to avoid another laser beam. It tastes like the scent of rust, and you can feel grit rolling across your tongue. It seems you're no longer Dazed.

> [[ HP: 17 / 35 ]]

What will you do?
> Run left. You need to get out of range of that beam and find the rest of your party.
> Run backwards. If you can get support from Aelriss and Eunoia, you can find a new approach.
> Try to maneuver into range and challenge the golem head on.

> [[ 41 ]]

You can hear the party—well, someone, at least—somewhere to the left, but you think you can avoid the next attack. You elect instead to follow the sound of Eunoia's chirping, stagnant water splashing onto the walls adjacent as you whirl around on a heel and get moving.

You duck low, moving left to right, but it's too late before you first look over your shoulder. As you approach a corner a distance ahead, you feel a burning heat on your back, carrying a force that sends you flying to the ground several feet away.

> [[ HP: 9 / 35 ]]

You scramble into a standing position, gripping the smooth wall corner with the fingertips of your torch-hand and pulling yourself around, out of the construct's view, as further blasts cut chunks of stone from the wall you were heading towards.

38902239.name: Sylvetica
38902239.comment:
>>38902212

[spoiler]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VCuPR9scGRk[/spoiler]

“Ascheritte!” Aelriss shouts, jogging towards you with heavy steps, Tatsumaki following behind her. Eunoia flutters from her shoulder to yours, and you're bathed in a faint green glow that you can't see as well over the light of your torch. “Are you alright? Have you found the others?”

> [[ HP: 10 / 35 ]]

“They're somewhere down a branch the way I came, but the boss is coming this way.” You respond, recounting your immediate experience. “We don't have much time to move, and there's no way we can take it on in these straight tunnels. It'll cut all of us down.”

“Hang on, we've got Nel's map.” Her UI projects a flat rendition of the labyrinth—it's the map Nel made before you fought the Pegasus—and she points to a particular location. “The ceiling's gone for some reason, but this is the only tunnel with this setup of branches, which means the three of us are at this corner. Look, if we can distract it, one of us or someone from the other group could maybe get behind.”

“Alright...” You sigh, pointing to a branch a few feet away from you that leads toward where you heard shouting. “We might be able to meet up with the others if we circle back the way you were coming from, but the golem will be tailing us the entire time. I don't think we can...”

Tatsumaki grabs your wrist, forcibly moving your hand to point toward a more central location on the map, where a number of tunnels meet. You and Aelriss give her strange looks, and she tilts her head before clearing her throat.

“Int-er-sec-tion.” She cups her gauntleted hands, bringing them together slowly. It's a gesture, indicating enclosing something—from all sides.

“Oh... I didn't see... That might work, actually.” Aelriss says. “If we surround him, he can't aim at more than one or two of us at a time. Whenever he's looking one way, everyone else has more room to pick up the slack...”

38903456.name: Sylvetica
38903456.comment:
>>38902257

[spoiler]Sorry for the slow turnarounds; it's a habit I'd broken until now, apparently, as I'm not feeling well at all today.[/spoiler]

> [[ HP: 27 / 35 ]]

Eunoia flutters from your shoulder, reuniting with Aelriss as you consume a healing potion.

“Alright, then.” You ask. “Who's got the short straw?”

“We're about to find out. Remember the map.” Aelriss closes her Identifier. “Take the long way around, alright? The furthest branch down this tunnel. If anything goes wrong, message one of the others.”

“Gotcha.” You respond. Tatsumaki nods.

The golem stomps, rounds the corner, and the three of you turn and start moving, fanning out to avoid the laser fire. You're quicker, this time, and more prepared, unwilling to be caught off guard yet again. It charges forward with unfamiliar speed, though, and you split off into an adjacent branch, Aelriss at your side, turning quickly to see it speed past.

“It's going after Tatsumaki.” She calls. “Let's get going!”

“Looks faster than before. Sure she's got it?” You ask.

A pause, then Aelriss nods. “Yeah, c'mon. The others are up ahead. They'll beat us to their positions, if Nel's doing his job at all.”

Lighting the way with your fluorescent torch, you allow Aelriss to navigate, leading you down the winding labyrinthine tunnels, noticing your elevation seems to fluctuate a bit as you go. Echoing down the branches, surrounding you, you hear heavy footsteps, slow, flowing water, and echoing shouts, cries and commands.

“There!” Around the next corner, you see people ahead, and pick up the pace. Vyx and Kainzo are at the end of the tunnel with their backs to a wall, leaning to look into the intersection up ahead. It's a larger room, where the elevation tapers down to a central point like a massive drain system. You can see water pouring from some places above, like the tunnels outside.

> [[ Continued ]]

38903495.name: Sylvetica
38903495.comment:
>>38903456

“Oh, Ascheritte.” Kainzo raises an eyebrow as you approach. “How... pleasant. We didn't have particularly high hopes for your survival, after attempting something so ridiculous upstairs. Would you mind giving us some warning in the future, before you subject us t—“

“Shut up! That was awesome!” Vyx says, standing on tiptoe in an attempt to intimidate Kainzo—then immediately shrinks back down, clasping her hands over her mouth and turning red in the face. “Uh, I mean. That was horrible! How dare you do such a thing... uhm. Ask-eritte?”

“Ascheritte.”

“I am so sorry.” She pulls her hood over her head, looking legitimately distressed—for a second, at least.

“Save it for later.” Aelriss says. “Where's Nel?”

“Leading the others to their positions. He insisted the two of us wait here.” Kainzo says. He looks equal parts injured and unamused. “I'm told you located the boss?”

“Tatsumaki's going to lead it to the center, right there.” You say.”Then, we'll all be able to go in at once.”

“Smart.” Kainzo responds.

“It was her idea.” You shrug.

“I assumed.” He says, turning and drawing his sword. “Either way, the two of you will have to usher yourselves into position, as Nel's gone. In short, find a tunnel. I assume we're operating under time constraints.”

> Find a spot nearby and wait with Aelriss. Can't leave your support alone.
> You'll want to pair ranged with melee—find Ayla, and have Aelriss reunite with Donnel or Nel.
> Wait alone in the center and have Tatsumaki lead it directly to you.
> Other.

38904685.name: Sylvetica
38904685.comment:
>>38903495

“Ael, this way.” You make your way toward the center, then point toward one of the far tunnels. “She's coming from there, right? We'll want to be on the far side so we can go at it from the arm that's more damaged already.”

“I think so.” Aelriss responds. “Unless she got turned around, which is entirely possible. If anything, we'll want to be at a diagonal, to minimize the distance you have to cross if we're on the wrong side.”

“Hey, Ashe!” On the far side of the central chamber, you see Nel leading a small group—Donnel, Dorian, and Andor—face dimly illuminated from below by his map projection. “Glad to see you're on your feet!”

“Yes, you've made a lot of people very upset.” Dorian sighs.

“That's cool,” You say. “I'll make up for it. Where do you want us, Nel?”

“Aelriss gave me the low-down on everything that's going on here, so just pick a spot I guess. Once I work out positions for the four of us I'm going to defer to your judgment.” He says, folding his arms. “Sticking with Aelriss?”

“Yeah,” You nod. “You know, I don't trust her alone.”

“Hey.” Aelriss snaps. “Watch it.”

“Take it easy, you two. Nel, Kainzo was right, wasn't he?” Andor says. “See? There's more ways to contribute to a team than just dealing damage. Without a map of this place, we'd have been picked off one-by-one.”

“That's cool,” You say. “I'll make up for it. Where do you want us, Nel?”

“Aelriss gave me the low-down on everything that's going on here, so just pick a spot I guess. Once I work out positions for the four of us I'm going to defer to your judgment.” He says, folding his arms. “Sticking with Aelriss?”

“Yeah,” You nod. “You know, I don't trust her alone.”

“Hey.” Aelriss snaps. “Watch it.”

“Take it easy, you two. Nel, Kainzo was right, wasn't he?” Andor says. “See? There's more ways to contribute to a team than just dealing damage. Without a map of this place, we'd have been picked off one-by-one.”

Light seeps from the exit wound, and cracks spiderweb across the surface; you tumble to the ground in time to see the explosion, the red lights around you fading.

“He's disabled it!” You hear Kainzo shout, and get back on your feet as he charges past you, moving into range with a mighty leaping swing. “Finish this, now!”

A barrage of caster bolts, increasing in frequency as Vyx closes the distance, bombards the Construct in the chest, accompanied by small explosions that aggregate into a great, obscuring cloud of smoke. Andor and Donnel strike again, ducking backwards as Dorian looses his spell—a luminescent guillotine of wind that crosses the arena floor, bisecting whatever remains of the Guardian Construct with a great display of iridescent lights and a shower of brilliant crystal fragments.

38907157.name: Sylvetica
38907157.comment:
“I think Nel deserves it.” You suggest. “What Andor said was true—without his map of this labyrinth, the whole raid would have been toast. Anyone opposed?”

“Sounds alright with me, I guess.” Donnel says. “We would definitely have lost a man or two down here, so...”

You look down at Tatsumaki, who gives a hurried nod.

“Wait, really?” Nel asks. “You aren't joking?”

“I don't think he's that cruel.” Aelriss says. “Maybe stupid.”

“Alright, then. So be it.” It's hard to hand off; though you've had it for mere seconds, it's like parting with something that—though material—you've kept close for your entire life. It leaves you with a hollowness, brief, though pronounced.

“Awesome!” Nel says, tucking it away, looking content. “I'll try harder next time, promise!”

“We're gonna have to think about upgrading your weapons pretty urgently.” Donnel says. “Ael, can you do anything for him?”

“I'd have to dismiss and unbind Eunoia, recover my PP, hassle the members of our raid for elemental foci, recover my PP again, then re-commit and resummon her.” Aelriss responds. “So, no.”

> [[ Continued ]]

“For now, we'll just hope that our enemies don't have as much raw damage resistance going forward.” Kainzo approaches. “We'll go ahead and ignore the fact that if that's the case, then they'll be compensating in other ways.”

“Damage resistance, huh?” Aelriss says. “He was tough, but he didn't seem that heavily armored...”

“I'm not sure if it works by flat reduction.” Kainzo says. “But it would explain why Vyx was dealing so little damage, and why Nel couldn't do any at all. Whereas attacks like Ascheritte's and Dorian's, ridiculous and untimely as they were, were more influential in taking it down.”

“Makes sense.” Hah! Validation. Well, sort-of. “But we can't celebrate right now...”

“Right, I'm aware there's much more to this place. Right now, we need to worry about getting back upstairs. Then, we'll see about continuing—and if anyone wants to opt out.” Kainzo folds his arms.
